main event: A sighting of an unidentified aerial object near Coldwater, Ohio on April 29, 1952.
interesting points: The object was described as disc-shaped, tending on edge, and the color of 'cherry red hot iron'.
The object was estimated to be about 1/3 the size of a full moon.
The object was drifting faster than a balloon could drift.
The winds in the area were measured and reported to help determine the object's movement.
The observers were unsure if the object could have been a weather balloon or 'piballs', which are difficult to track.
sighted object: disc-shaped object, cherry red in color
